1.text: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.

2.text: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same who is made sorry by me?

3.text: And I wrote this same to you, lest, coming I should have sorrow from them by whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.

4.text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly to you.

5.text: But if any hath caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.

6.text: Sufficient to such a man is this punishment, which was inflicted by many.

7.text: So that on the other hand, ye ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such one should be swallowed up with excessive sorrow.

8.text: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm your love towards him.

9.text: For to this end also I wrote, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye are obedient in all things.

10.text: To whom ye forgive any thing, I forgive also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave it, for your sakes I forgave it, in the person of Christ;

11.text: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

12.text: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach the gospel of Christ, and a door was opened to me by the Lord,

13.text: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother; but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.

14.text: Now thanks be to God, who always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savor of his knowledge by us in every place.

15.text: For we are to God a sweet savor of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:

16.text: To the one we are the savor of death to death; and to the other the savor of life to life. And who is sufficient for these things?

17.text: For we are not as many, who corrupt the word of God: but as from sincerity, but as from God, in the sight of God we speak in Christ.
